meanings.definition: A type of soil characterized by a thick, organic-rich surface layer and a subsurface layer containing aluminum and iron oxides.
meanings.sent1: The spodosols in the forest have a dark top layer full of organic material.
meanings.sent2: Gardening experts recommend using spodosols for growing certain plants.
meanings.sent3: The spodosols were so rich in nutrients that the plants grew twice as tall!
meanings.sent4: The spodosols were like a treasure chest, hiding valuable minerals beneath the surface.
meanings.sent5: Walking on the spodosols felt like stepping on a soft, spongy carpet.

meanings.definition: Soils that are typically found in cool, moist climates and are common in coniferous forests.
meanings.sent1: The spodosols in the forest keep the trees healthy and strong.
meanings.sent2: Hikers enjoy the cool, damp feel of spodosols under their feet.
meanings.sent3: The spodosols whispered secrets to the curious hiker passing by.
meanings.sent4: The spodosols were a cool, refreshing oasis in the middle of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The spodosols painted the forest floor in shades of green and brown.
